Definition: Gallbladder cancer is a rare type of cancer that occurs in the gallbladder.
Causes: Gallstones, chronic inflammation, and certain genetic factors.
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, jaundice, and unexplained weight loss.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies, blood tests, and biopsy.

Definition: Gallstones are hardened deposits that can form in the gallbladder.
Causes: Imbalance in bile components, obesity, and certain diets.
Treatment: Surgery to remove the gallbladder or non-surgical methods to dissolve stones.

Definition: Gas gangrene is a severe bacterial infection that produces gas in tissues.
Causes: Infection with Clostridium bacteria, often following trauma.
Symptoms: Severe pain, swelling, and gas production in tissues.
Treatment: Surgical intervention, antibiotics, and sometimes hyperbaric oxygen therapy.

Definition: Gastrointestinal cancer refers to cancers that affect the digestive system.
Causes: Genetic factors, lifestyle choices, and certain infections.
Symptoms: Varies by type but may include abdominal pain, changes in bowel habits, and weight loss.
Treatment: Surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, and targeted therapies.

Definition: Gastrointestinal stromal tumors are rare tumors that occur in the digestive tract.
Causes: Genetic mutations, often associated with the KIT gene.
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, nausea, and gastrointestinal bleeding.
Treatment: Surgery and targeted therapy with imatinib.

Definition: Gastroparesis is a condition that affects the stomach muscles and prevents proper stomach emptying.
Causes: Diabetes, nerve damage, and certain medications.
Symptoms: Nausea, vomiting, and feeling full after eating small amounts.
Treatment: Dietary changes, medications, and in severe cases, surgery.

Definition: Germ cell tumors are tumors that arise from germ cells, which can develop into sperm or eggs.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but may involve genetic factors.
Symptoms: Varies by location but may include lumps, pain, and hormonal changes.

Definition: Gestational trophoblastic disease is a group of rare tumors that involve abnormal growth of cells in the uterus.
Symptoms: Abnormal bleeding, enlarged uterus, and high levels of hCG.
Treatment: Surgery and monitoring of hCG levels.

Definition: Glaucoma is a group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve, often due to high eye pressure.
Causes: Increased intraocular pressure, family history, and age.
Symptoms: Loss of peripheral vision, blurred vision, and halos around lights.

Definition: Glioblastoma is an aggressive type of brain cancer that arises from glial cells.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but may involve genetic mutations.

Definition: A goiter is an enlargement of the thyroid gland.
Causes: Iodine deficiency, autoimmune diseases, and thyroid nodules.
Symptoms: Swelling at the base of the neck, difficulty swallowing, and changes in voice.
Diagnosis: Physical examination, blood tests, and imaging studies.

Definition: Golfer's elbow is a condition characterized by pain on the inner side of the elbow.
Symptoms: Pain and tenderness on the inner elbow, stiffness, and weakness.
Treatment: Rest, ice, physical therapy, and anti-inflammatory medications.

Definition: Goodpasture syndrome is a rare autoimmune disease that affects the lungs and kidneys.
Causes: Autoimmune response against the basement membrane.
Symptoms: Coughing up blood, shortness of breath, and kidney failure.
Diagnosis: Blood tests, imaging, and kidney biopsy.

Definition: Gout is a form of arthritis characterized by sudden, severe pain, redness, and tenderness in joints.
Causes: High levels of uric acid in the blood.
Symptoms: Intense joint pain, swelling, and inflammation.
Diagnosis: Physical examination and joint fluid analysis.
Treatment: Medications to reduce pain and inflammation, and lifestyle changes.

Definition: Graft versus host disease occurs when donor cells attack the recipient's body after a transplant.
Causes: Bone marrow or stem cell transplants.

Definition: Granulomatosis with polyangiitis is a rare autoimmune disease that causes inflammation of blood vessels.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but involves an autoimmune response.
Symptoms: Sinusitis, kidney problems, and respiratory issues.
Diagnosis: Blood tests, imaging studies, and biopsy.

Definition: Graves' disease is an autoimmune disorder that causes hyperthyroidism.
Causes: Autoimmune response leading to overproduction of thyroid hormones.
Symptoms: Weight loss, rapid heartbeat, and anxiety.
Diagnosis: Blood tests measuring thyroid hormone levels.
Treatment: Antithyroid medications, radioactive iodine, and surgery.

Definition: Groin pain is discomfort in the area where the abdomen meets the thigh.
Symptoms: Pain, swelling, and difficulty moving the leg.
Treatment: Rest, ice, physical therapy, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: Guillain-Barré syndrome is a rare neurological disorder where the body's immune system attacks the nerves.
Causes: Often follows a viral or bacterial infection.
Diagnosis: Clinical evaluation and nerve conduction studies.
